intro: Acronychia chooreechillum, commonly known as the Northern Territory acronychia, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by woody, spherical fruits containing one or two seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
